instruction: What kinds of spectra were used in the investigation of modelling available water capacity (AWC) and soil water retention (SWR)?
Output: The investigation used visible-near-infrared spectra (vis-NIR) to model available water capacity (AWC) and soil water retention (SWR).

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were employed in the investigation of modelling available water capacity (AWC) and soil water retention (SWR)?
Output:
The spectral feature processing methods employed in the investigation were: 
- Direct modelling of AWC with average spectra
- Estimating water contents at field capacity and permanent wilting point and calculating AWC from those estimates
- Modelling AWC with spectra of air-dried soils
- Fitting parameters of the Kosugi and van Genuchten SWR models and reconstructing SWR curves to calculate AWC

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the spectroscopic methods in the investigation of modelling available water capacity (AWC) and soil water retention (SWR)?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the accuracy of the spectroscopic methods in estimating AWC and SWR was the root-mean squared-error (RMSE).

instruction: What machine learning method was used in the investigation of modeling available water capacity (AWC) and soil water retention (SWR) using visible-near-infrared spectra (vis-NIR)?
Output: The machine learning method used in the investigation of modeling available water capacity (AWC) and soil water retention (SWR) using visible-near-infrared spectra (vis-NIR) was cubist.

instruction: How does the accuracy of spectroscopic methods compare to traditional pedotransfer functions (PTFs) in estimating available water capacity (AWC) and soil water retention (SWR)?
Output: The accuracy of spectroscopic methods in estimating available water capacity (AWC) and soil water retention (SWR) was generally better than traditional pedotransfer functions (PTFs). The root-mean squared-error (RMSE) of the spectroscopic methods ranged from 0.033 cm(3) cm(-3) to 0.059 cm(3) cm(-3), while the RMSEs of the PTFs were 0.050 cm(3) cm(-3) for the local PTF and 0.077 cm(3) cm(-3) for the general PTF. Therefore, the spectroscopic methods performed with higher accuracy compared to the PTFs in estimating AWC and SWR.
